//Intenet Issues Network not available. Please make sure you are connected to the Internet and try again. Connection failed. Please try again. Your Internet Connection is slow. Lost Internet Connection //QB Login Errors Unauthorized User //Loading Dialogs Logging in, please wait... Loading, please wait... //Login Screen Connecting people across world Access ID Password I Accept Terms and Conditions Login If you\'re facing any problem, feel free to Contact Us Please accept terms and condition to continue Empty access id and password Wrong access id and password Access ID cannot be greater than 10 digits Password cannot be smaller than 6 digits This user is already logged in on a different device Login failed //Dashboard Screen FAQ Change Language History Help-Center Share Logout Time EXPIRED DAY Date Conference Room Name Upcoming Ongoing Both All Slide left/right to view other Select Conference Room Expired Reminder already added This group is not yet scheduled. No calendars found. Please ensure at least one google account has been added. Error adding reminder No calendar account selected Refresh Failed. Try again. Select a calendar account //FAQ Screen FAQ\'s Expand All Collapse All What is KENANTE? KENANTE is a Virtual Interaction tool that makes it possible for you to connect with your consumers, wherever they might be, instantaneously over a Video Call What is the process of using this application? Once the app is installed from play store, you need to enter your credentials and log-in. You then need to join the respective scheduled meeting. Is KENANTTE available on iOS, Android or Web? Yes, it is available all the platforms. Country where does KENANTE support? Kenante is available across the globe What are the minimum requirements to use KENANTE APP? You need to have smart phone with 3G /4G network connection. For Android, it should be at least 4.4 Kitkat OS. For iOS, it should be greater than 10. For Web, it should be supporting the latest version of Chrome, Firefox or Safari. I haven’t received my logging-in credentials yet. What should I do? Please reach out to Kenante Help Desk for assistance. How will I get to know when a new meeting is scheduled for me? You will get a notification on your app as well as an e-mail from Team Kenante. I am facing problems with signing-in. Please suggest the way ahead. You should contact the Help Desk. What should I do when the video is not audible? Earphone/ Helpdesk We recommend using the earphones. If the issue is still not resolved, please contact the Help Desk. The quality of audio/video is not good. What should I do? Please check your internet connection. It is possibly an internet issue. I have mistakenly dropped out of the meeting. Please let me know, how do I re-join. You need to go back to your meeting screen and re-join the call. My chat messages are not getting delivered. What should be done? Please check your internet connection. It is possibly an internet issue. I am not able to view the image/video shared by the moderator. What should I do? Please check your internet connection. It is possibly an internet issue. I haven’t received my logging-in credentials yet. What should I do? Please reach out to Kenante Help Desk for assistance. //Conference Details Fragment Respondent Details Age SEC Gender User Key Instructions: Please make sure you have a good smart phone with battery charged. Please make sure you are at a place with minimum of 4G internet. Earphones are recommended for the call. Earphones are recommended for the call. Please make sure that your phone camera is not directed straight towards light and your face is clearly visible. Join //Call Screen No users present to chat First close screen sharing You can only hear moderator and respondent. You can only hear translator. Wired headset plugged in Your Conference session may get closed due to bad Internet Connection. Connecting your call Rejoining you to call. This may take around 30 seconds. You are already on call with some other device. You got disconnected from call. Rejoining you to call. Closing call... //Full Chat Screen No Chat with this user Failed Loading Image //Setup Call With Link Screen Wrong password //Incoming Call Screen You have cut this call. To join conference session kindly start it clicking the green button on top. Error occurred. Try calling manually. //Change Language Screen Change Language //Others Facing Issue Write your problem Unsupported Format File sent Try again You need to grant all these permissions to continue. To continue you need to allow recording permission Video finished Error occurred While Playing Video Error occurred. Try creating this group again. Note Your audio and video may be recorded and seen by others. Cancel Okay Yes No Terms and Conditions Attended Starting call. Please wait... moderator respondent translator client admin T recorder No Internet access... Please check internet settings No groups exist Add Group Enter text Please wait! None of the members have joined the conference yet. Kenanté: Terms and Condition

This document is an electronic record in terms of Information Technology Act, 2000 and rules there under applicable and the amended provisions pertaining to electronic records in various statutes as amended by the Information Technology Act, 2000. This electronic record is generated by a computer system and does not require any physical or digital signatures.

This document is published in accordance with the provision Technology (Intermediaries guidelines) Rules and regulations, privacy policy and Terms of Use for access or usage of Kenanté mobile phone application for android, IOS operating and also available on Web.

The Kenanté Application by Varenia Consumer Insights and Measurement Solutions Private Limited (hereinafter referred to as Varenia CIMS) is under license. Varenia CIMS is a company incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013, India. In these terms of use, Kenanté may refer to website/ web based application, mobile phone application.

Kenanté

Your use of Kenanté and its associated services and tools are governed by the following terms and conditions (Terms of Use) as applicable to Kenanté including the applicable policies which are incorporated herein by way of reference. If you shall be subject to the policies that are applicable to Kenanté for such transaction. By mere use of Kenanté, you shall be contracting with VARENIA CIMS Pvt. Ltd. and these terms and conditions (including the policies) constitute your binding obligations, with VARENIA CIMS Pvt. Ltd.

 

Website and mobile phone application for Android and iOS operating systems Terms of Use

 

These terms and conditions of use (Terms of Use) of Kenanté (as defined below) between Kenanté and the users/ registrants of Kenanté (You or Your or Yourself or User) describe the terms on which Kenanté offers You access to Kenanté and the Services (as defined below) through Kenanté.

 

PLEASE READ THE TERMS OF USE CAREFULLY BEFORE USING OR REGISTERING ON Kenanté OR ACCESSING ANY MATERIAL, INFORMATION OR SERVICES THROUGH Kenanté. YOUR USE OF Kenanté OR THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY Kenanté SHALL SIGNIFY YOUR ACCEPTANCE OF THE TERMS OF USE AND YOUR AGREEMENT TO BE LEGALLY BOUND BY THE SAME.

YOUR USE OF Kenanté IMPLIES THAT YOU AGREE WITH THE TERMS OF USE.

  1. General

1.1 Use of Kenanté is offered to you conditioned on acceptance of all the terms, conditions and notices contained in these Terms, along with any amendments made by Kenanté at its sole discretion and posted on Kenanté, including by way of imposing an additional charge for access to or use of a Service.

1.2 Kenanté shall not be required to notify you, whether as a registered user or not, of any changes made to the Terms of Use. The revised Terms of Use shall be made available on Kenanté. Your use of Kenanté and the Services is Subject to the most current version of the terms of Use made available on Kenanté at the time of such use. You are requested to regularly visit the home page in the Kenanté Mobile app to view the most current Terms of Use. You can determine when Kenanté last modified the Terms of Use by referring to the last Updated legend above. It shall be your responsibility to check these Terms of Use periodically for changes. Kenanté may require You to provide Your consent to the updated Terms of Use in a specified manner prior to any further use of Kenanté and the Services provided on Kenanté. If no such separate consent is sought, your continued use of Kenanté, following changes to the terms of Use, will constitute Your acceptance of those changes.

 

1.3 By (i) using this website or mobile phone application for Android and iOS operating system in any way; or (ii) merely browsing Kenanté, or downloading mobile phone application for Android and iOS operating system on your mobile phone handset, you agree that you have read, understood and agreed to be bound by these Terms of Use and Kenanté Privacy Policy available at the homepage,

 

2 Services

2.1 Kenanté is a platform that facilitates the user to choose to enter into a contest/ contest program and upon answering completely, become eligible for special points, discount coupons and/or offers

 

3 Eligibility to Use

3.1 The services are not available to minors under the age of Fifteen (15) or to any Users suspended or removed from the Kenanté system by Kenanté or Varenia CIMS for any reason whatsoever. If You do not conform to the above qualification, You shall not be permitted to avail of the Services or use Kenanté. You represent that You are of legal age to form a binding contract and are not a person barred from receiving services under the law as applicable in India.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, if you are below the age of Fifteen (15) years, You may avail the Services provided by Kenanté through Your legal guardian in accordance with the applicable laws provided the user has his own mobile

3.2 Kenanté reserves the right to refuse access to use the Services offered at Kenanté to new Users or to terminate access granted to existing Users at any time without according any reasons for doing so.

3.3 The user registration is based on the concept of ONE USER ONE MOBILE NUMBER Concept and therefore, User can register only one name with one mobile number.

In case a new user registers on the same mobile phone, the previous user will no longer be deemed as the user on that mobile. In case the user has switched mobile numbers, they need to update their profile via Application/ Website or register again as a new user. Any benefits accrued to user in the old registered to the new account.

 

  1. User Account, Password, and Security

4.1 Kenanté makes the service available to you through Kenanté application for Android and iOS operating systems only if you have provided Kenanté certain required User information and created an account (Account) through Kenanté iD and password or log-in ID and password, which may include a Facebook, Gmail, Yahoo ID or any other valid email ID (collectively, the Account Information). The Services may also be subject to procedures for use of Kenanté Website/web app or mobile phone application for Android and iOS operating systems, Terms of Offer for Sales/Use, uploaded guidelines, rules, additional terms of service, or other disclaimer and notices, if any (Additional Terms). If there is any conflict between the Terms of Use and the Additional Terms shall take precedence in relation to that service.

4.2 Kenanté requires You to register as a User by creating an Account in order to avail of the Services provided by Kenanté. You will be responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of Account Information, and are fully responsible for all activities that occur under your Account. You agree to (a) immediately notify Kenanté of any unauthorized use of your Account Information or any other breach of security, and (b) ensure that You exit from Your Account at the end of each session. Kenanté cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from Your failure to comply with this Section 4.2 You may be held liable for losses incurred by Kenanté or any other user of or visitor to Kenanté due to authorized or unauthorized use of your Account as a result of your failure in keeping Your Account Information secured and confidential.

4.3 Kenanté also allows restricted access to the Services for unregistered users.

4.4 You shall ensure that the Account Information provided by you in Kenanté registration form is complete accurate and up to date. Users of another user Account Information for availing the services is expressly prohibited.

4.5 If you provide any information that is untrue, inaccurate, not current or incomplete (or becomes untrue, inaccurate, not current or incomplete), or Kenanté has reasonable grounds to suspect that such information is untrue, inaccurate, not current or incomplete, Kenanté has the right to suspend or terminate your account and refuse any and all current or future use of Kenanté (or any portion thereof)

4.6 Any personally identifiable data (which includes Phone number, email ID and Address) of the user will not be shared with any third party by Kenanté, but aggregated data (without the personally identifiable information) can be shared with other third party. The data based on contest done by various users would be collected in aggregate form which may be age wise, gender wise, city wise or as the case may be and in aggregate form. Subject to any force majeure event, in no circumstances, Kenanté would release personally identifiable information of the individual users to other companies without prior permission from the said user.

 

5 Offers / Discount

Information

 

5.1 Kenanté shall be under no liability whatsoever in respect of any loss or damage arising directly or indirectly out of the decline of redemption of points/ discount coupons/ offers by the merchandise/ service providers, on account of any reason whatsoever. This shall remain a matter to be resolved between the parties carrying out the transaction(s).

 

6 User Obligations

 

6.1 Subject to compliance with the Terms of Use, Kenanté grants you a non-exclusive, limited privilege to access and use this website and/ or mobile phone application for android and IOS operating systems and the Services therein.

6.2 You agree to use the Services, Website or mobile phone application for android and iOS operating systems and the materials provided therein only for purposes that are permitted by : (a) the terms of Use and (b) any applicable law, regulation or generally accepted practices or guidelines in the relevant jurisdictions.

 

6.3 You agree to adhere to all limitations on dissemination, use and reproduction of any materials (such as the product catalogues) that you access on Kenanté in accordance with section 7.

 

6.4 You agree not to access (or attempt to access) Kenanté and the materials or Services by any means other than through the interface that is provided by Kenanté. You shall not use any deep-link, robot, spider or other automatic device, program, algorithm or methodology, or any similar or equivalent manual process, to access, acquire, copy or monitor any portion of Kenanté or content (as defined below), or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of Kenanté, materials or any content, to obtain any materials, documents or information through any means not specifically made available through Kenanté.

 

6.5 You acknowledge and agree that by accessing or using Kenanté or Services, You may be exposed to content from other users that you may be exposed to content from other users that you may consider offensive, indecent or otherwise objectionable. Kenanté disclaimed all liabilities arising in relation to such offensive content on Kenanté. Further, you may report such offensive content in the manner prescribed under section 17 herein.

 

6.6 If website or mobile phone application for android and iOS operating systems allows you to post and upload any material on Kenanté, you hereby undertake to ensure that such material is not offensive and in accordance with applicable laws. Further, you undertake not to:

Defame, abuse, harass, threaten or otherwise violate the legal rights;

Impersonate any person or entity, or falsely state or otherwise misrepresent your affiliation with a person or entity;

Publish, post, upload, distribute or disseminate any inappropriate, profane, defamatory, infringing, obscene, indecent or unlawful topic, name, material or information through any bookmark, tag or keyword;

 

Upload files that contain software or other material protected by applicable intellectual property laws unless you own or control the rights thereto or have received all necessary consents;

 Upload or distribute files that contain viruses, corrupted files, or any other similar software or programs that may damage the operation of Kenanté or another computer; Engage in any activity that interferes with or disrupts access to Kenanté or the Services (or the servers and networks which are connected to Kenanté);

 

Attempt to gain unauthorized access to any portion or feature of Kenanté, any other systems or networks connected to Kenanté to any Kenanté server, or to any of the Services offered on or through Kenanté by hacking password mining or any other illegitimate means;

Probe, scan or test the vulnerability of Kenanté or any network connected to Kenanté, nor breach the security or authentication measures on Kenanté or any network connected to Kenanté or any other customer of Kenanté , including any Kenanté account not owned by you, to its source, or exploit Kenanté or service or information made available or offered by or through Kenanté, in any way whether or not the purpose is to reveal any information, including but not limited to personal identification information, other than your own information, as provided for by Kenanté;

 Disrupt or interfere with the security of, or otherwise cause harm to, Kenanté systems resources, accounts, Kenanté or any transaction being conducted on Kenanté, or with any other person use of Kenanté;

Use Kenanté or any material or content for any purpose that is unlawful or prohibited by these terms of use or to solicit the performance of any illegal activity which infringes the rights of Kenanté or other third parties;

Download any file posted by another user of a service that you know, or reasonably should know, cannot be legally distributed in such manner;

Falsify or deleted any author attributions, legal or other proper notices or proprietary designations or labels of the origin or source of software or other material contained in a file that uploaded;

Violate any code of conduct or other guidelines, which may be applicable for or to any particular service;

Violate any applicable laws or regulations for the time being in force within or outside India;

Violate the terms of use including but not limited to any applicable additional terms of Kenanté contained herein or elsewhere; and

Reverse engineer, modify, copy, distribute, transmit, display, perform, reproduce, publish, license, create derivative works from, transfer, or sell any information or software obtained from Kenanté.

 

6.7 You agree that you are solely responsible to Kenanté and to any third party for any breach of your obligations under the terms of use and for the consequences (including any loss or damage which Kenanté or its affiliates or its vendors may suffer) for any such breach.

 

6.8 You agree that Kenanté may, at any time, modify or discontinue all or part of Kenanté, charge, modify or waive fees required to use Kenanté, or offer opportunities to some or all website or mobile phone application for android and iOS operating systems users as the case may be.

 7 Use of materials

 7.1 Except as expressly indicated to the contrary in any applicable additional terms, Kenanté hereby grants you a non-exclusive, freely revocable (upon notice from Kenanté), non-transferable access to view, download and print product catalogues or any other materials available on Kenanté, subject to the following conditions:

You may access and use the materials solely for personal, informational, and internal purposes, in accordance with the terms of use. This would also include your right to share the same on Facebook, Twitter and other social network and platforms;

You may not modify or alter product catalogues or any other materials available on Kenanté;

You may not distribute or sell, rent, lease, license or otherwise make the product catalogues or any other materials available on Kenanté.

7.2 The rights granted to you in the product catalogues or any other materials as specified above are not applicable to the design, layout or look and feel of Kenanté. Such elements of Kenanté are protected by intellectual property rights and may not be copied or imitated in whole or in part. The product catalogues or any other materials available on Kenanté may be copied or retransmitted unless expressly permitted by Kenanté.

 7.3 Any software that is available on Kenanté is the property of Kenanté or its vendors. You may not use, download or install any software available at Kenanté, unless otherwise expressly permitted by these. Terms of use or by the express written permission of Kenanté.

7.4 Any points/ discount / offer code generated on Kenanté will be strictly for personal use of the user currently registered on that mobile number. The user hereby expressly agrees that any points/ discount/ offer code generated by the user on Kenanté will be sold, resold, bartered or in any way used for any commercial purposes or for profit. The user hereby acknowledges that the discount offer code is not transferrable to any third party for profit.

 8 Usage Conduct

8.1 You shall solely be reasonable for maintaining the responsible for maintaining the necessary electronic equipment (e.g. computer, mobile phone etc.) and internet connections that may be required to access, use and transact on Kenanté.

8.2 You are also under an obligation to use this website or mobile phone application for android and iOS operating systems for reasonable and lawful purposes only, and shall not indulged through Kenanté.

8.3 You shall use this website or mobile phone application for android and IOS operating systems, and any voucher/ coupons/ code generated through it, for personal, non-commercial use only and shall not re-sell the same to any other person.

8.4 Kenanté shall be under no liability whatsoever in respect of any loss or damage arising directly or indirectly out of the decline of authorization for any transaction.

 9 Intellectual Property Rights

9.1 Kenanté and the processes, and their selection and arrangement, including but not limited to all text, graphics, user interfaces, visual interfaces, sound and music (if any), artwork and computer code (collectively, the content) on Kenanté is owned and controlled by Kenanté and the design, structure, selection, coordination, expression, look and feel and arrangement of such content is protected by copyright, patent and trademark laws, and various other intellectual property rights.

9.2 The trademarks, logos and service marks displayed on Kenanté (Marks) are the property of Kenanté or their vendors or respective third parties. You are not permitted to use the marks without the prior consent of Kenanté, the vendor or the third party that may own the marks.

9.3 Unless otherwise indicated or anything contained to the contrary or any proprietary material owned by a third party and so expressly mentioned, Kenanté owns all intellectual property rights to and into the trademark Kenanté, and Kenanté, including, without limitation, any and all rights, title and interest in and to copyright, related rights, patents, utility models, designs, know-how , trade secrets and inventions (patent pending), goodwill, source code, meta tags, databases, text content, graphics, icons, and hyperlinks.

9.4 Except as expressly provided herein, You acknowledge and agree that you shall not copy, republish, post, display, translate, transmit, reproduce or distribute any content through any medium without obtaining the necessary authorization from Kenanté or third party owner of such content.

 10 Third Party Content

 Kenanté makes available general third party information such as, product catalogues, lists of authorized dealers, and reports on news, entertainment, technology and features, advertisements including videos, images and photographs of the products and other data from external sources (third party content). Similar third party content may also be available to you on any email or other communication received by you from Kenanté. The provision of third party content is for general informational purposes only. You acknowledge that the third party content provided to you is obtained from sources believed to be reliable. Kenanté does not provide any guarantee with respect to any the third party content and Kenanté shall not be held liable for any loss suffered by you based on your reliance on or use of such data. The user can also not claim any rights over any third party content provided on Kenanté unless explicitly so stated.

 

11 Disclaimer Of Warranties and Liability

YOU EXPRESSLY UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT, TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW:

 

11.1 Kenanté, SERVICES AND OTHER MATERIALS ARE PROVIDED BY Kenanté ON AN AS IS BASIS WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF TITLE, NON INFRINGRMRNT, MARCHANTABILTY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. WITHOUT LIMITING THE FOREGOING, Kenanté MAKES NO WARRANTY THAT (I) Kenanté OR THE SERVICES WILL MEET YOUR REQUIREMENTS OR YOUR USE OF Kenanté OR THE SERVICES WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE OR ERROR FREE; (II) THE RESULTS THAT MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE USE OF Kenanté, SERVICES OR MATERIALS WILL BE EFFECTIVE, ACCURATE OR RELIABLE; (III) THE QUALITY OF Kenanté, SERVICES OR OTHER MATERIALS WILL MEET YOUR EXPECTATIONS; OR THAT (IV) ANY ERRORS OR DEFECTS IN Kenanté , SERVICES OR OTHER MATERIALS WILL BE CORRECTED. NO ADVICE OR INFORMATION, WHETHER ORAL OR WRITTEN, OBTAINED BY YOU FROM Kenanté OR THROUGH OR FROM USE OF THE SERVICES SHALL CREATE ANY WARRANTY NOT EXPRESSLY STATED IN THE TERMS OF USE.

 

11.2 TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, Kenanté WILL HAVE NO LIABILITY RELATED TO USER CONTENT ARISING UNDER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS, LIBEL, PRIVACY, PUBLICITY, OBSCENITY OR OTHER LAWS. Kenanté ALSO DISCLAIMS ALL LIABILITY WITH RESPECT TO THE MISUSE, LOSS, MODIFICATION OR UNAVAILABILITY OF ANY USER CONTENT.

 

11.3 Kenanté WILL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY LOSS THAT YOU MAY INCUR AS A CONSEQUENCE OF UNAUTHORIZED USE OF YOUR ACCOUNT OR ACCOUNT INFORMATION IN CONNECTION WITH Kenanté OR ANY SERVICES OR MATERIALS, EITHER WITH OR WITHOUT YOUR KNOWLEDGE. Kenanté HAS ENDEAVORED TO ENSURE THAT ALL THE INFORMATION ON Kenanté, BUT Kenanté NEITHER WARRANTS NOR MAKES ANY REPRASENTATIONS REGARDING THE QUALITY, ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF ANY DATA, INFORMATION, PRODUCT OR SERVICE. Kenanté SHALL NOT BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DELAY OR INABILITY TO USE Kenanté OR RELATED FUNCTIONALITIES, THE PROVISION OF OR FALIURE TO PROVIDE FUNCTIONALITIES, OR FOR ANY INFORMATION, SOFTWARE, PRODUCTS, FUNCTIONALITIES AND RELATED GRAPHICS OBTAINED THROUGH Kenanté, OR OTHERWISE ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF Kenanté, WHETHER BASED ON CONTRACT, NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY OR OTHERWISE. FURTHER, Kenanté SHALL NOT BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR NONABILITY OF Kenanté DURING PERIODIC MAINTAINANCE OPERATIONS OR ANY UNPLANNED SUSPENSION OF ACCESS TO Kenanté THAT MAY OCCUR DUE TO TECHNICAL REASONS OR FOR ANY REASON BEYOND Kenanté CONTROL. THE USER UNDERSTANTS AND AGREE TAHAT ANY MATERIAL OR DATA DOWNLOADED OR OTHERWISE OBTAINED THROUGH Kenanté IS DONE ENTIRELY AT THEIR OWN DISCRETION AND RISK AND THEY WILL BE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGE TO THEIR COMPUTER OR MOBILE PHONE SYSTEM OR LOSS OF DATA THAT RESULTS FROM THE DOWNLOAD OF SUCH MATERIAL OR DATA. Kenanté IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY TYPOGRAPHICAL ERROR LEADING TO AN INVALID REDEMPTION COUPON. Kenanté ACCEPTS NO LIABILITY FOR ANY ERRORS OR OMISSIONS, WITH RESPECT TO ANY INFORMATION PROVIDED TO WHETHER ON BEHALF OF ITSELF OR THIRD PARTIES.

11.4 Kenanté SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY THIRD PARTY PRODUCT OR SERVICES. THE ADVERTISEMENT AVAILABLE ON E- MAIL OR WEBSITE OR MOBILE PHONE APPLICATION FOR ANDROID ANDIOS OPERATING SYSTEMS WITH RESPECTTO THE THIRD PARTY WEBSITE OR THE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES ARE FOR INFORMATION PURPOSE ONLY.

12 Indemnification and Limitation of Liability

12.1 You agree to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Kenanté including but not limited to its affiliate vendors, agents and employees from and against any and all losses, liabilities, claims, damages, demands, costs and expenses (including legal fees and disbursements in connection therewith and interest chargeable thereon) asserted against or incurred by Kenanté that arise out of, result form, or may be payable by virtue of any representation, warranty, covenant or agreement made or obligation to be performed by you pursuant to these terms of use. Further, you agree to hold Kenanté harmless against any claims made by any third party due to, or arising out of, or in connection with, your use of Kenanté, any claim that your material caused damage to a third party, your violation of the terms of use, or your violation of any rights of another, including any intellectual property rights.

12.2 Notwithstanding anything to contrary, Kenanté entire liability to you under these terms of use or otherwise shall be to provide you with another points/discount/ offer code of any retailer/ merchandise for any points/discount/ offer related to specific voucher or product or service, under which the unlikely liability arise.

12.3 In no event shall Kenanté, its officers, directors, employees, partners be liable to you, the vendor or any third party for any special, incidental, indirect, consequential or punitive damages whatsoever, including those resulting from loss of use, data or profits, whether or not foreseeable or whether or not Kenanté has been advised of the possibility, including breach of contract or warranty, negligence or other tortuous action, or any other claim arising out of or in connection with your use of in connection with your use of or access to Kenanté, Services or materials.

 

12.4 The limitation and exclusions in this section apply to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law.

 

13 Violation of the terms of use

13.1 You agree that Kenanté may, in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate your access to Kenanté and block your future access to Kenanté if Kenanté determines that you have violated these terms of use or additional terms. You also agree that any violation by you of these terms of use will constitute an unlawful and unfair practice, and will cause irreparable harm to Kenanté, for which monetary damages would be inadequate, and you consent to Kenanté obtaining any injunctive or equitable relief that Kenanté deems necessary or appropriate in such circumstances. These remedies are in additional to any other remedies Kenanté may have at law or in equity.

 

13.2 You agree that Kenanté may, in its sole discretion, and without prior notice, terminate your access to Kenanté, for cause, which includes (but is not limited to) : (1) request by law enforcement or other government agencies; (2) a request by you (self initiated account deletion); (3) discontinuance or material modification of Kenanté or any services offered on or through Kenanté ; or (4) Unexpected technical issues or problems.

 

13.3 If Kenanté does take any legal action against you as a result of your violation of these terms of use, Kenanté will be entitle to recover from you, and you agree to pay, all reasonable attorney fees and cost of any other relief granted to Kenanté.

 

14 Termination

14.1 The terms of use will continue to apply until terminated by either you or Kenanté as set forth below. If you want to terminate your agreement with Kenanté, you may do so by (i) not accessing Kenanté for twelve months; or (ii) closing your accounts for all of the services that you use, where Kenanté has made this option available to you.

 

14.4 Kenanté may, at any time, with or without notice, terminate the terms of use with you (or portion thereof, such as any individual Additional Terms) and forfeit the points balance in your account if:

You breach any of the provisions of the terms of use, the privacy policy or any other terms, conditions, or policies that may be applicable to you from time to time (or have acted in a manner that clearly shows that you do not intend to, or are unable to, comply with the same)

Kenanté is required to do so by law (for example, where the provision of the service to you is, or becomes, unlaw); or

Kenanté has elected to discontinue, with or without reason, access to Kenanté, the services (or any part thereof); or

The provision of the services to you by Kenanté is, in Kenanté opinion, no longer commercially viable;

14.3 Kenanté may also terminate or suspend all or a portion of your account or access to the services with or without reason. Expect as may be set forth in any additional terms applicable to a particular service, termination of your account may include: (i) removal of access to all offerings within Kenanté or with respect to the services: (ii) deletion of your materials and account information, including your personal information, log in ID and password, and all in ID and password, and all related information, files and materials associated with or inside your account (or any part therefore); and (iii) baring of further use of the services.

14.4 You agree that all terminations shall be made in Kenanté sole discretions and that Kenanté shall not be liable to you or any third party for any termination of your account(and accompanying deletion of your account information), or your access to Kenanté and services.

14.5 Notwithstanding the foregoing, these terms of use will survive indefinitely unless and until Kenanté chooses to to terminate them.

14.6 If you or Kenanté terminates your use of Kenanté , Kenanté may delete any content or other materials relating to your use of Kenanté and Kenanté will have no liability to you or any third party for doing so.

 

15 Governing Law

You agree that all claims, differences and disputes arising under or in connection with or in relation hereto Kenanté , the terms of use or any transactions entered into on or through Kenanté or the relationship between you and Kenanté shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts at New Delhi, India and you hereby accede to and accept the jurisdiction of such courts.

 

16 Report Abuse

In the event you come across any abuse or violation of these terms of use or if you become aware of any objectionable content on Kenanté, please report to Kenanté Customer Support.

Privacy Policy

17 Privacy Policy

The user hereby consents, expresses and agrees that he has read and fully understands the privacy policy of Kenanté in respect of Kenanté. You further consent that the terms and contents of such privacy policy are acceptable to you.

 

18 Communications

18.1 You hereby expressly agree to receive communications by way of SMS, e-mails, newsletters and any other appropriate communication media from Kenanté relating to Services provided through Kenanté.

18.2 User can unsubscribe/ opt-out from receiving communications from Kenanté by sending feedback to us via Kenanté mobile application or website or by contacting us via email requesting the same.

 

19 General Provisions

19.1 Notice : All notices of Kenanté will be served by email or by general notification on Kenanté application or website. Any notice provided to Kenanté pursuant to the terms of use should be sent to Kenanté contact details provided on application/ website.

19.2 Assignment : You cannot assign or otherwise transfer the terms of use, or any rights granted hereunder any third party . Kenanté rights under the terms of use are freely transferable by Kenanté to any third parties without the requirement of seeking your consent.

19.3 Severability : If for any reason, a court of competent jurisdiction finds any provision of the terms of use, or portion thereof, to be unenforceable, that provision shall be enforced to the maximum extent permissible so as to give effect to the intent of the parties as reflected by that provision, and the reminder of the terms of use shall continue in full force and effect.

 

19.4 Waiver : Any failure by Kenanté to enforce or exercise any provisions of the terms of use, or any related right, shall not constitute a waiver by Kenanté of that provision or right.

 

20 Feedback and Information

Any feedback you provide to this website or mobile Application for any android or iOS operating systems shall be free to use such information on an unrestricted basis. Further, by submitting the feedback, you represent and warrant that (i) your feedback does not contain confidential or proprietary information of you or of third parties (ii) Kenanté is not under any obligation of confidentiality, express or implied, with respect to the feedback (iii) Kenanté may have something similar to the feedback already under consideration or in development; and (iv) You are not entitled to any compensation or reimbursement of any kind from Kenanté for the feedback under any circumstances.

Privacy Policy

Last Update: 14 October 2018

Varenia CIMS Pvt. Ltd., operator of Kenanté, is committed to safeguarding your privacy online. 

This page discloses the privacy practices of the Kenanté mobile application and website. If you arrived at this page via one of our cobranded partner sites, please be assured that the privacy policy that you see here is in effect for all Kenanté panel members regardless of how they are directed to our registration form. 


Information We Collect

 

The Application collects the following information:

 

Information You Provide:

  • Personal information you provide prior to and during the registration process and from time to time thereafter, including name, mailing address, primary email address, and mobile phone number;
  • Other information you provide during the registration process such as your company, title, gender, and mobile device registration information;
  • Response to questions in the survey/contest.
  • Images, videos, audio and other data you purposely send us through the Application (e.g., images of products and the bar codes of such products, etc.).
  • Occasionally some of you might be requested to participate in a survey/contest where your interview will be live streamed to our clients. We will inform you over email, app or a call in case you are selected for such a survey/contest. You can choose to be a part of that survey/contest or not, the decision is entirely up to you.

Device Activity:

  • Occasionally we might also capture Application usage activity. This is as some of our surveys/contests are based on your usage of certain applications, for example, we might send you a survey/contest if you use a movie booking application on your phone.

Location:

  • Occasionally we might also capture location of your phone to verify or crosscheck the center from where the responses are being filled for the survey/contest. Sometimes, some of our surveys/contests are location based, for example, when you are in the vicinity of a petrol pump. In these cases, we will send you a survey/contest for you to participate if you visited that petrol pump.

Device or System Data:

  • Standard technical information about your device, system, network, and application software, e.g., unique device identifier, device model, operating system, language set, browser type and version, the date and time of your visit, and IP address.

 

Our Privacy Pledge
When you participate as a panel member, we want you to be aware of our privacy practices:

  • Except as described in this privacy policy, we will not make any personal identifying information of our panel members available to anyone without your knowledge (as described in this policy), except in the rare instances required by law. This includes your name, postal service address, phone number, and email address.
  • We will never try to sell you anything - that is not our business. We will never sell your name to anyone else who might want to use your name to directly sell you anything.
  • Occasionally, we may contact you to validate responses. We will never misrepresent ourselves or what we are doing.
  • Your individual responses to surveys/contests will also be kept confidential and will never be linked to your personal identifying information.
  • Your decisions about participating in a study, responding to specific questions, or discontinuing participation will be respected without question.

 

How Information Is Used:
The Information We Collect and How We Use It

When you register as a panel member, we collect the following personal identifying information: your name, postal service address, email address, and phone number.

We use your name and email address to let you know about opportunities to take surveys/contests, to provide new updates about Kenanté that may be of interest to our panellists and to inform you about special programs and benefits we are offering to our panel members (such as special gifts or incentives). Generally, panel members are notified about an opportunity to take a survey/contest several times per month. We also send brief emails to our interactive panel members several times a year to provide information of interest and to express our appreciation for their participation.

We use postal service addresses to mail free gifts offered to panel members, products to test, and/or merchandise that you redeem with your Reward Points. Products to test and cash redemptions may be mailed directly to panel members by the Kenanté team and thus do not require sharing of your name and address with outside parties. However, your name, postal service address and email address may also be shared with Kenanté reward suppliers when you redeem your Rewards. Points so they can ship to you directly. Occasionally, we ask our interactive panel members if they would be willing to take certain special paper and pencil surveys/contests. We ask your permission prior to mailing such surveys/contests or sending our representative to your address with prior appointment, as well as providing information about the benefits of taking such a survey/contest. 

We call panel members in response to their request for a return call to answer a question or address any concerns. We also call panel members for answering some surveys/contests which need quick responses or need detailed interaction which cannot be done through our app or website only. On rare occasions, we call panelists to validate survey/contest responses. 

Kenanté frequently asks panel members for demographic information (e.g., age, gender, household composition, etc.), computer and web access capabilities, and lifestyle information (e.g., types of vehicles owned or business/recreational travel, etc.). Kenanté uses this information to select surveys/contests that are appropriate for the panel member (or a member of the panelists household). For example, a survey/contest related to satisfaction with stays at various hotel chains might be sent only to those panelists who indicate a certain frequency of travel. We sometimes use birth date information to send birthday greetings to our panel members.

Kenanté asks panel members for their opinions about a variety of products and services by asking them to complete surveys/contests via the Kenanté app or website or over a call. Usually, Kenanté combines the individual panelist responses and reports on the aggregated (or group) results. Individual level responses are occasionally used, but in general not associated with any personal identifying information without your explicit consent. 

Kenanté may occasionally ask for personal identifying information as part of a specific survey/contest . In these cases, we will provide an explanation in the survey/contest introduction to allow panel members to make an informed decision about participation. The explanation will include a description of any new personal identifying information that will be collected via the survey/contest and with whom it will be shared. As with any survey/contest , members can decline to take the survey/contest or stop at any time during the survey/contest process. Like all other information we collect, any personal identifying information collected for a specific survey/contest will be used for research purposes only.


Kenanté also automatically collects information via log files to administer the app and the site and to aid in technical problem solving. Log file information collected is IP address, time a page was viewed, name of pages viewed within the Kenanté site during the specific visit, browser type, URL parameters, and cookies that were set by the Kenanté website at the time of the visit. Log files may also include information indicating where a visitor came from. This information is used only to administer the site and to identify and resolve any technical problems related to the site's operation.

When you participate in the Refer-a-Friend Program we ask for your friend's first name and email address. The first name is used in the greeting to personalize the message and the email address is needed to deliver it to your friend. Both pieces of information are only stored long enough to make sure the email was sent without difficulty and never used for any other purpose. Participation in the referral program, like all aspects of Kenanté membership, is completely voluntary.

This app and the website has security measures in place to protect the loss, misuse, and alteration of the information under our control. Panel member names, postal service addresses, and phone numbers are maintained on a secured database accessible only by Varenia CIMS staff. Panel members may also access their own information for the purposes of verifying and updating, but they cannot view other members' information. As with any Internet endeavor, absolute security of information transmitted through channels (communication networks, hardware, software) not directly operated or controlled by us cannot be guaranteed.

In the event we or our affiliates experience a merger, acquisition, sale or other transaction pursuant to which this website is acquired by a third party or another affiliate, your personal identifying information may be disclosed to the third party or affiliate both before and after the transaction, for the sole purpose of facilitating and effecting that transaction. In the event a transaction is consummated, you will be notified of the transaction via email and/or through a notice on our app or website, and custody of your personal identifying information will be transferred subject to all the terms and restrictions in this privacy policy.

Updating Your Personal Information:
Policies on Correcting/Updating Personal Identifying Information

Kenanté relies on panel members themselves to provide any updates to personal identifying information. Members may update email addresses, password, postal service address, phone number as well as name of the person who initially registered by going to the Update Your Info section of this website (available to members only). Please ensure that you change your password regularly to optimize the security of your account. For changes to any other personal identifying information, including email address, panel members are asked to edit information in the my profile page of the Kenanté app or website. Kenanté may also exchange information with our partner sites for the member's benefit and with the member's knowledge (in accordance with this privacy policy). These benefits include opportunities to earn additional rewards on the partner site and/or to eliminate Kenanté advertising to those who are already Kenanté members. The information exchanged will be the member ID and/or email address (the minimum information needed to provide the benefit). We require our partner sites sign a written, legally binding agreement stipulating they will not share your individual identifying information and that it is to be used solely for the purpose of providing you with additional rewards and to eliminate redundant advertising. 

Opt-Out Policy:
Your Decision Not To Participate

Panel members may decline to respond to a survey/contest or opt to drop interactive panel membership at any time. Panelists who prefer not to complete a given survey/contest need not do so.

Panelists who would like to withdraw their membership from the panel may do so at any time on the Kenanté app or Site. Panelists may withdraw membership by clicking on the unsubscribe link found at the bottom of the My Profile page in the member area of the Kenanté site or uninstalling the Kenanté mobile app. We will process all unsubscribe requests within 10 business days of receipt and usually within 48 hours of receipt.

Upon receipt of the drop request, Kenanté may ask you to complete brief survey/contest about the reason(s) for discontinuing membership. This survey/contest is optional and does not involve any additional email; any results will help us improve panel members' experience. Thereafter, Kenanté will stop sending survey/contest notifications.

Notification Of Changes:
How We Notify You About Changes to Our Privacy Policy

If we are going to use your personal identifying information in a manner different from that stated in our privacy policy at the time of collection, we will notify you via email or call. You will have a choice as to whether or not we use your information in this different manner; instructions for how to make that choice will be included in the email. If we make any material changes to our privacy practices that do not affect user information already stored in our database, we will post a prominent notice on our website notifying our members that there is a change and pointing them to the revised privacy page.

Privacy Policies Used In 3rd Party surveys/contests

We conduct studies with partner companies on the partner's website, which may operate under a different privacy policy. Like all our other studies, participation in these studies is completely voluntary and informed. We notify select members about these research opportunities and provide a complete description of what is involved and any member benefits. In all these cases, we will explicitly state if the privacy policy in operation for the study is the Kenanté privacy policy or a different policy. As necessary, we will provide a link to the partner's privacy policy or to the policy pertaining to the particular study. This information will be available at the beginning of the survey/contest and consent will be asked from panel members.

Updates to this Privacy Notice

We reserve the right to update and make changes to this privacy policy. If we materially change our practices in handling personally identifiable information, as described in this statement, we will notify you by sending a message to the most recent email address you provided to us. If you do not want your information used in the new way, you should notify Kenanté of your intent to cancel participation and follow the instructions Kenanté will subsequently send you for manual removal of the Application. Your continued participation in the survey/contest after the effective date of any changes constitutes your acceptance of all of the changes.
